Class ConsoleBoundary

java.lang.Object
team5.boundaries.ConsoleBoundary
Direct Known Subclasses:
InternshipBoundary
public abstract class ConsoleBoundary extends Object
Abstract base class providing utility methods for console input/output operations. This class contains helper methods for formatting output, parsing user input, displaying prompts, and handling date formatting. All methods are static to allow easy access throughout the application.

  • Method Details

    • clearScreen

      public static void clearScreen()
      Clears the console screen using ANSI escape codes. This method may not work on all terminal types.

    • safeValue

      public static String safeValue(Object value)
      Converts an object value to a string, returning "N/A" for null or empty values. This method provides safe display formatting for potentially null object values.
      Parameters:
      value - the object to convert to string
      Returns:
      the string representation of the value, or "N/A" if null or empty

    • valueOrNA

      public static String valueOrNA(Enum<?> value)
      Converts an enum value to its string name, returning "N/A" for null values. This method provides safe display formatting for enum values.
      Parameters:
      value - the enum value to convert
      Returns:
      the name of the enum constant, or "N/A" if null

    • parseDate

      public static LocalDate parseDate(String text)
      Parses a date string using multiple supported formats. Attempts to parse the input using various date formats including yyyy-MM-dd, dd MM yyyy, and d M yyyy (for single-digit days/months).
      Parameters:
      text - the date string to parse
      Returns:
      the parsed LocalDate object
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the date string cannot be parsed with any supported format

    • promptUserInput

      public static String promptUserInput()
      Prompts the user for input and returns the trimmed input string. Reads a line from the console and removes leading/trailing whitespace.
      Returns:
      the trimmed user input string

    • promptUserInput

      public static String promptUserInput(boolean withHeader)
      Prompts the user for input with an optional header message. If withHeader is true, displays a standard prompt message before reading input.
      Parameters:
      withHeader - if true, displays "Enter your choice or 0 to return:" before prompting
      Returns:
      the trimmed user input string
